newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan foreign reserves fall to $756 million.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan foreign reserves fall to $756 million.

text.p: Pakistan's foreign reserves, excluding gold, have sunk to $756 million from $831 million on October 3, State (central) Bank of Pakistan Governor Muhammad Yab said on Tuesday.
Yaqub said reserves were falling because of debt repayments concentrated in the first half of 1996/97 (July-June).

He said a run on foreign currency deposits and a slowdown in remittances amid rumours about the health of the economy had also put pressure on the reserves, which stood at $1.13 billion in September, compared with $1.52 billion a year earlier.
Pakistan has about $800 million in gold and special drawing rights, Yaqub said.
Yaqub said the situation was now stable with banks reporting an increase of $16 million in deposits in the past few days.
